name: Caravelle Hotel

reviews.text: This a beautiful hotel but you pay the price. Splurge for the breakfast buffet. Rooms are beautiful but not nearly as grand and special as the lobby. Excellent location.
reviews.title: Expensive night of luxury

reviews.text: I stayed for five nights on business in early December. Cannot fault the hotel, the breakfasts were wonderful, although the piped Christmas carols did jar after a couple of days. The staff were always friendly and smiling, I even got a torn shirt repaired invisibly and never got billled for it.
reviews.title: Fake snow and christmas trees!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great position for exploring the shops and tourist sights on foot and didn't feel threatened at any time. Plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance although crossing the busy streets takes courage and is not for the faint hearted.
reviews.title: Great location in district 1
Fantastic Caravelle
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Caravelle our last 2 nights in Vietnam. Check in was quick, staffs were very friendly and attentive. We had a large room in the new wing. The room was nicely decorated, with a touch of Asia style. Comfortable bed and soft pillows. Small complaint about the bathroom is that the hot water takes time to warm up. We ate breaksfast buffet at Ninteen restaurant, is was okay. It's a perfect location hotel in Vietnam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a signature room in the old wing which had the softest pillows and mattress imaginable. Wonderful food, staff friendly, could not wish for a better few days.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but Overrated and Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Caravelle is a great hotel, its in a central location, near to the histroic and beautiful Post Office and Notre Dame Cathedral. Our room had wonderful views over the city, and the room itself though not exciting was very comfortable with a bed you could sink into, with its feather bed topper. But the best part of this hotel was the massive choice of delights you could have for breakfast, if you were really greedy you could eat and eat, there was amost too much to choose from, Yum! The Caravell is a quality hotel.
reviews.title: Smart and Central Caravell

reviews.text: This is a good hotel, but having seen what my company was paying presumably on a "preferential" rate since we were holding an event there simply not worth the money. The hotel apparently has historic value from the Vietnam war but there is very little suggest this in what is basically a modern concrete slab. Although must be said Saigon Saigon is a good bar if not making nearly as much of its history as it might do.
reviews.title: Nice but overpriced

reviews.text: Rooms are large, the bed is huge but otherwise decidely unexceptional for a 5 star hotel in this price range. Service was good overall though and breakfast pretty decent.
reviews.title: Caravelle is absolutely the best hotel in Saigon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gym had reasonable range of equipment however some of the weights equipment is getting quite rusty - not exactly five star in my book.
reviews.title: Great hotel right in the centre

likes.liked: — prime location great views breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Compared to the Mandarin Oriental in KL a week earlier, which cost less, and many other places I could think of in the region, the Caravelle really doesn't live up to how much it costs.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Saigon (HCMC)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps I was spoilt after spending 2 weeks prior to our stay at the Caravelle in some very luxurious hotels in Hong Kong and Vietnam, however I was a little disappointed with this hotel. The location was fantastic, very central, within walking distance to some really nice restaurants and bars, and we had some nice views of Ho Chi Minh City. On arrival we were greeted with the same level of genuine warmth as seems to be standard across Vietnam however this slipped once we had an issue with the room.
reviews.title: Great Location but not a 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: We had paid to stay in a deluxe river view room, however when we got to our room there was no sign of the river, we questioned this and were then moved to another room which was clearly a standard double room with the river no where in sight. Again, we queried this and were told that we’d have to pay for an upgrade to go back to the room we were originally checked into, the girl said they had originally upgraded us to this deluxe room but didn’t bother to tell us! When we showed her that we were supposed to be staying in a deluxe room with a river view and refused to pay more for what we had already paid for, she became clearly annoyed and started typing aggressively and shouting very loudly at her colleague who had to move our luggage again, I don't speak Vietnamese but I can only imagine what was being said by the tone of her voice and the expression on her face!
reviews.title: Excellent base to visit Saigon

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds and views of the city
likes.disliked: — The pool being cold and windy in the afternoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this aside, the hotel is nice but not worthy of its 5 start status, I get the feeling its living off its past history a bit, the Saigon Saigon Bar is also overated. The Sheraton hotel is right behind the Caravelle and I couldn’t help but wish we were staying there instead.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A luxury hotel, priced reasonably in an excellent location in Saigon. Opposite the Opera House and within walking distance of the Post Office and Cathedral. Service was excellent, staff always tried their hardest and were polite and courteous. The bedrooms are 5* with comfortable beds. Interconnecting rooms are available for those with children. The swimming pool get shady in the afternoon and a cool/cold breeze picked up as the afternoon went on (though you don't come to Saigon to lie by a pool). Like all of Saigon the traffic (mainly scooters) is very heavy all the time and driving is done with the hand on the horn, so requesting a room on a higher floor will give you a quieter night. If you don't get a rate inclusive of breakfast (and the breakfast is very good) try the Mojo a happening cafe around the corner from The Caravelle owned by the Sheraton but not accessible from the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: Great location. Good solid 5 star performer. Saigon Saigon Bar a little overrated but the hotel itself is very good. Great hotel for a tourist - especially a first time tourist to Ho Chi Minh City
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.text: i have stayed here many times for business. for personal travel i might stay somewhere cheaper. but its great for business. clean and modern. excellent location. great breakfast restaurant. good bar on 9th floor open air with a view. the hotel itself doesn't feel very vietnamese, but all you need do is step outside or look out the big window for that. very comfortable, modern hotel. good sized room as well.
reviews.title: i always stay here

reviews.text: Excellent - service, food, hotel rooms. Loved it, except for the price.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Service was excellent, staff was very helpful, nice rooms, and great pool. Only draw back I had was, very little storage space (two small drawers in the entire room and counterspace in bathroom was quit narrow). All in all a great place to stay and l would do stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Relaxed

likes.disliked: — not a place to stay for more than 2 weeks

reviews.text: Stayed here with my MBA cohort whilst consulting for local firms. The rooms are large and clean, but the place hasn't been updated in ten years so little bits are beginning to let down this five star (eg. My bed sagged so I kept rolling into the middle). I'd say in a first-world city this hotel would only be four stars, but it's certainly as good as you can get in HCM city.
reviews.title: Another large corporate five star (would be 4 in another country)

likes.liked: — Nice pool with bar and large breakfast selection (but not much for vegetarians.
likes.disliked: — mattress (sagging caused me to roll into centre, and pillows way too thick give crick in neck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights September 2007. Very central position. Nice comfortable large room on 21st floor with dual aspect, but intermittent noise from renovations during the day. Pool and spa services very good. Saigon bar overpriced drinks and served without canapes/nibbles. Despite these small inconviences would recommend to others.
reviews.title: Good location
Solid international hotel, in a good location
reviews.text: My partner and I spent 4 nights at this property, and by all accounts we found it to be a good, solid international hotel. I would probably say 4.5 star (not quite 5 though).

likes.disliked: — It wasn't unique or special in any way. If you're happy to pay I would personally check out the Park Hyatt across the street

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, in that all the main tourist attractions are easily within walking distance (Reunification Palace, Notre Dame Cathedral, Benh Than Markets etc.).
reviews.title: Saigon Best Location

reviews.text: The hotel does have a lovely pool, and one of the better gym's I've seen in the hotel. No doubt aimed at more the business traveller, it was still a nice place to stay while on vacation. Nothing special to report about the room. A nice big, comfortable bed, but everything else standard (we had a Deluxe King Room on a high floor).
reviews.title: Super location and service - loved the Caravelle

reviews.text: Our first morning we decided to eat breakfast in the hotel....US$36 for two....ouch!!! That's 3-4 times more what you'll pay outside of the hotel. I know outside of Vietnam US$36 isn't huge money, but when you're in a country where $36 goes a long way, it is a bit of rip-off so we never ate in the hotel again, aside from having beers on the terrace of the Saigon Saigon bar, which I definitely would recommend doing at sunset one evening.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We were 4 family members who had 2 rooms at the Caravelle for 4 nights which included Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. We've all been to HCMC a couple of times, but this was the first time at the Caravelle. It is now our preferred hotel here--second choice would be the Duxton, if budget doesn't allow for the Caravelle. I stayed in the Grand in Feb. 08, which is a huge disappointment--as a beautiful French Colonial-era building it has the potential to be really terrific, but is far, far from that (its cheaper price is no excuse for such tacky presentation), so never again there. The Caravelle's public areas are much smaller than the neighbouring Sheraton (no loss, in our view), but elegant and beautifully decorated. We loved the Christmas decorations and how all the staff entered into the spirit of the festive season--loved the choir of orphan/street kids that visited a few times. All staff, esp. reception, could not be more helpful and cheerful. Breakfasts are just as a previous reviewer described--everything you'd ever want. Only one small quibble is that I cannot abide tea from those large perspex teapots that sit around stewing on a hotplate--ugh! We each asked for, and got after quite a wait each morning, an individual pot each. No big deal, but this standard of hotel could easily do this as a regular service. The large bedrooms themselves had every comfort and convenience, with the notable exception of internet access--no wifi, and a steep charge for internet access, as someone else has mentioned. Again, not acceptable these days--for what is still a poor country, Vietnam has a high take-up of technology amongst locals, so hotels of this standard can and should be able to improve their service in this respect--at the moment, it's a nice little extra earner for them. As also noted by others, the beds are blissfully comfortable, everything is very clean and well presented--but yes, I agree that the decor does have a bit of a bland, "universal-corporate" look about it, but it is still good--quite fresh and not at all worn, as alas, one reviewer found. The only real complaint about the room is that it's almost impossible to adjust the air-con to other than freezing--my 2 other family members sharing a twin room on another floor found the same thing. Again, these days management should be able to deal with this sort of problem reasonably effectively. However, all in all, we'll certainly go back to the Caravelle. It's location is about as good as it gets in HCMC, and we also just liked the scale of everything at the Caravelle over and above say, the Sheraton, which is, I suspect, quite a bit more expensive and for no real advantage that we could see. We didn't have Christmas Day lunch at the Caravelle, but went across the street to the very ritzy and glam (whose rooms are vastly more expensive) Park Hyatt, who offered a sit-down, set menu at almost the same price as the Caravelle's buffet (which is good for breakfast, but hate for other meals). This was superb in every respect for food, ambience, wonderful service, indeed everything, and will certainly be on our dining/drinks/afternoon tea must-do list in HCMC in future. Those who love good interior decor should definitely go and check out the Park Hyatt. Ref. one reviewer's comment that the Caravelle is some distance from the airport: would you really want to be stuck in a hotel right out there in "Siberia"? Like many cities, HCMC's airport area is just a grim district to pass through as quickly as possible! District 1 is without doubt the best place for visitors--everywhere you want to go is accessible, restaurants, shops, Reunification Palace, Cathedral, etc. all walkable, esp. from Caravelle, and other attractions only a short, cheap taxi ride.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in HCMC

likes.liked: — Fabulous location, friendly staff, overall high quality of hotel and presentation
likes.disliked: — Air-con. in room virtually impossible to adjust from near-freezing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there twice on a recent trip and cannot recommend the hotel for any reason other than location. It lacked the charm of an older hotel and the glitz of a newer place. Our rooms were drab and a bit overused. Carpets were a bit worn and the bathroom tile had unsightly scuffs and damages. The air conditioning quit once in the night and we woke up sweaty.
reviews.title: Great location but that's about all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can get past the tour group atmosphere you will find great views and an unsurpassed location. Breakfast was excellent and the hotel staff was very pleasant. That said, I wouldn't stay again.
reviews.title: Xmas 2008

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel twice during our trip The first was an overnight stay before we travelled to The Furama, Da Nang and the second was from 26.12. -29.12. I only wish my employer would put me into hotels of this quality for business trips.
reviews.title: Great hotel, for a price. But no wireless internet

reviews.text: The hotel was excellent and facilties superb. If you are into gyms then this was the place to go and despite being in a city we managed to sunbathe and catch up on the suntan
reviews.title: Nice historial hotel.... but a bit corporate

likes.disliked: — The renovation made it a bit generic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a couple of nights here. It's a nice but unexceptional hotel. The room was clean and well decorated, although there was no free internet and the cost for internet connection was pretty expensive. It's in a great location and the rooftop bar is a nice plus. There's a good gym and spa, although we had an odd experience on our first visit there, where they insisted that only one of us was registered in the room, so only one could use the gym. They came back repeatedly and, in front of all the other people using the gym, insisted that this was the case, then when they finally ascertained that we were both staying, they very quietly and privately apologised. Also, while we were there, we had some laundry done by an external service. This was returned to our room, but the hotel's laundry bag and price list was left very prominently on the bed. Given that we needed laundry done quickly, and that they were charging $9 for one shirt (no, that's not dry cleaning, nor does it include ironing), I thought this was a bit cheeky. If they want people to use their services (and, after all, this is a city centre hotel, not an isolated resort) they should charg more realistic prices. Overall, while it's a nice place to stay, I came away with the impression that this is about getting maximum money from guests, rather than providing good service.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: Reasonably good 5* hotel in the heart of Ho Chi Minh city. What I like about this place is the location. Dong Khoi Street is just outside the hotel and there are good restaurants, supermarkets, shops, spas within walking distance from the hotel. It's right in the centre of town and easy to navigate from.
reviews.title: Good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have time, can try the spanish restaurant that is located a block away from the hotel. Also try the french restaurant, Augustin, at 10 Nguyen Thiep Street - within 3 min walk from the back entrance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Honda rules ok?

likes.liked: — Felt very comfortable and it was most quite in a very noisy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Caravelle had such a history, almost iconic status, as the hotel from which the world was informed of the news Vietnam War in the 70’s, from the correspondents s based in it’s famous bar on the 9th floor, that I was expecting to be disappointed. I imagine and tired and slightly seedy building. This was not to be. The rooms were large with all the normal facilities plus bathrobes and great towels; so often these are the size of a postage stamp and the quality of sandpaper. We had a wonderful view of the noise and excitement of the streets below, with the Lam Son Square laid out in all its splendour.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff made you feel special; always and smile and a door opened when you came back from a hot day of seeing all or going out to one of the many restaurants that was just a few yards away from the hotel. It was my birthday whilst I was there and they even took the trouble to make me a cake! The famous bar is still there in the old part of the hotel and is very good at cocktails and afternoon tea. They also have a very good little shop where I brought good quality lacquer ware.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: After spending 2 weeks in Vietnam, it was great to go to a nice luxury hotel with 'western' comforts. Rooms are on the small side, but have amazing beds. they have a nice pool and gym, although at the bottom of the tower which makes it a little bit weird (both caravelle and sheraton guests can see you swimming). The good side of Caravalle is its location, right in the middle of everything, and their food. Breakfast was great, but their "seafood" buffet must be one of the world's best, you have everything, from clams,oysters, sushi, as well as meets, cheeses and great deserts (fondue,crumble...) i would recommend this hotel just for that!
reviews.title: Great food and very luxurious facilities

reviews.text: Excellent staff, nice rooms. Good pool for a City hotel. Great location within all of the attractions of the City.
reviews.title: THE hotel to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It puzzles me that the Carvaelle is a 5-star hotel, at least according to Trailfinders (UK-based travel agency). In my opinion, it may have 5-star facilities, but it has the service and ambience of a 3-star. To illustrate my view, I'll describe several incidents which occurred during my 6-day stay at the Caravelle.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, poor service, cold & unfriendly staff

reviews.text: 1) It's quite a shock to be charged exorbitant rates to use the internet in a 5-star hotel in this day and age. I have stayed in 5-stars all over the world and this is the first time I've had to pay for such a basic service. Not good enough.
reviews.title: 2x too much !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) I had booked a massage in the hotel's spa. When I arrived at the Spa in my robe, two gym attendants asked me loudly (in front of other guests) if I was wearing underwear (I kid you not). Despite my embarrassment, I declined the manky shorts one of the gym attendants offered and retrieved underwear from my room. I was not informed of the requirement for underwear when I booked the massage. Perhaps the Caravelle should make this clearer, especially to guests who are used to higher standards of Spa treatment.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

description: The Caravelle is the ideal venue for an elegant and stylish function. Conventions, banquets, meetings, large or small flourish under the expertise of the Banqueting team, whose purpose is to assure that every event has polish, grace and functionality.
